intro: Vladimiria trachyloma, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or red. Its leaves are ovate and covered in fine hairs, and it thrives in well-drained, rocky soils. Vladimiria trachyloma is often found in moist, shaded environments at higher elevations.
